result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Lee Hughey Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger Lee Hughey Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Roger Lee Hughey Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
OFF THE RECORD:  Defendant was recently moved to Dodge Correctional and was not produced for today's court.  Defense counsel requests that defendant be produced in person for next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case rescheduled off the record.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Roger Lee Hughey not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: B. Galloway - MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of 21CF1851. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
*Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Roger L. Hughey, Jr. - #2022006396, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Roger Lee Hughey not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is unavailable due to a personal matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due court congestion court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Stephen Sargent to be appointed pending a conflict check. Matter is adjourned for a preliminary hearing. Parties notified.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JMB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roger Lee Hughey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 35.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
